intro: Lebeckia melilotoides, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a South African native plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces bright yellow flowers resembling dandelions, typically blooming in spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to Mediterranean climates and is drought-tolerant once established. Lebeckia melilotoides is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
